item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by davec :
Fix Statement.toString to handle binary integer and Float types

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by davec :
Fix performance regression introduced by using InetSocketAddress.getHostName Thanks to Scott Harrington, Kris Jurka.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by davec :
Implemented query timeout Thanks to davec.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by davec :
First pass implementation of binary protocol Thanks to Mikko Tiihonen.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by davec :
Fixed broken jdk 1.4 builds Thanks to Mike Fowler.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by davec :
Stack overflow fix Thanks to Mike Fowler.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by davec :
SSL implementation to mimic libpq more closely Thanks to Andras Bodor.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by davec :
SSPI authentication support Thanks to Christian Ullrich.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by davec :
isValid implementation Thanks to Louis Flores.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
A BitSet is a compact representation if we're only considering builtin types that will have low oids, but if any user defined types are enabled, all bets are off. Once the oid counter exceeds INT_MAX, database connections were failing outright even if no high oid types used binary transfer because we represent these oids with negative values that a BitSet cannot handle.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by davec :
fix to build for java 1.8 Thanks to Mikko Tiihonen.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by davec :
Add support for hstore Thanks to Mikko Tiihonen.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by davec :
Implemented JDBC4 setBinaryStream Thanks to Johann Oskarsson.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by davec :
Implementation of simple connection failover Thanks to Mikko Tiihonen.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by davec :
Updated Brazilian Portuguese translation. Thanks to Euler Taveira de Oliveira.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by davec :
Allow changing of send recv buffer sizes Thanks to Bernd Helme.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by ringerc :
Documentation updates

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by davec :
Fix attacl for servers below 8.3

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix ResultSetMetaData retrieval when the oid counter exceeds INT_MAX. Since Java doesn't have unsigned ints we retrieve the values as long and then truncate to int, so it may have a negative value. Thanks to Owen Tran .

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Cache a copy of ResultSetMetaData in the ResultSet.
This solves a major performance problem for ResultSetMetaData users which did not cache the ResultSetMetaData object. One of the users is the driver's own implementation of updatable ResultSets, so this can't be worked around solely in end user code.
In the 9.0 and earlier releases, the Field objects were used to hold database lookup results and these were longer lived than the ResultSetMetaData object. Now that ResultSetMetaData is holding these database lookups we must hold onto the object to avoid repeating the database queries. Thanks to Steven Schlansker.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Set version to 901 for release Thanks to jurka.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Report permission metadata for a table with no permissions correctly. Thanks to danap.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Update default permissions to account for changes in different server versions. 8.2 removed the rule permission while 8.4 added a trunctate permission.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Ensure that an XAConnection throws SQLExceptions appropriately even though it's a proxy class. Before this change it was throwing an InvocationTargetException instead of the actual cause. Thanks to Yaocl.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Make updatable ResultSets work with SQLXML data. Thanks to Michael Musset.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
If a domain has a not null constraint, report that information in the metadata for both DatabaseMetaData.getColumns and ResultSetMetaData.isNullable. Thanks to Thomas Kellerer.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
In DatabaseMetaData.getSchemas, return the user's own temp schemas, but no others. Previously it wasn't returning the users own temp schema, but was showing all toast temp schemas. Thanks to Thomas Kellerer.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Newer server versions (9.0+) allow extra_float_digits to be set to 3 instead of the old limit of 2 to get the maximum precision of floating point values out of the server.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add support for setting application_name on both connection startup and later through Connection.setClientInfo.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Fetch all metadata for the ResultSet in one query instead of making a trip for each attribute of each column.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Change ResultSetMetaData to return information on serial datatypes in getColumnTypeName to match up with the behaviour of DatabaseMetaData.getColumns.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Bring getSchemas up to JDBC 4 compliance. Return the additional TABLE_CATALOG column that was added in JDBC 3. Additionally support the getSchemas method added in JDBC 4 which filters the returned schemas.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Bring getProcedures/getProcedureColumns up to JDBC 4 compliance. Both methods have added a SPECIFIC_NAME column that can be used to differentiate between overloaded functions. getProcedureColumns has added some other additional columns to describe the datatype being returned. Thanks to Thor Michael Store.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Update the date tests for changes in the 1.6 JVM. Older versions allowed five digit years and single digit days and months. The latest code only allows a strict yyyy-mm-dd. This changed somewhere between 1.6.0_11 and 1.6.0_21. Thanks to Mike Fowler.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Allow the driver to support setObject with Types.DISTINCT. We report metadata indicating that values are of this type, so we'd better accept it coming back in. Thanks to Vitalii Tymchyshyn.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix literals that are injected into a SQL query to contain the PG specific E'' marker if they are using the non-standard-conforming-strings backslash escaping. This will get rid of the warnings from escape_string_warning.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Use slightly different SQL State error codes for the different types of connection setup failures to indicate which can be retried and which cannot. Thanks to Donald Fraser and Kevin Grittner.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Support building with the 1.7 JDK.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Clear the generated keys associated with a Statement at the next execution. If the next execution doesn't want generated keys, we don't want to leave the old keys around.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Support returning generated keys from batch statement execution. Unfortunately we need to disable the actual batching that the driver does behind the scenes because now that it is returning potentially large result values we must avoid a deadlock.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
The 9.1 server canonicalizes the client_encoding setting, so if we ask for unicode we get utf8. This confused the driver because previous versions just echo back what we asked for. Ask for the canonical name now. Thanks to Mike Fowler.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When running tests, don't assume that we know the server's default transaction isolation level. Thanks to Kevin Grittner.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Work around a bug in the server's implementation of the binary copy protocol. Thanks to Matthew Wakeling.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Make ResultSetMetaData.getColumnType match the results of DatabaseMetaData.getColumns.DATA_TYPE for domain and composite types. Thanks to Thomas Kellerer.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix DatabaseMetaData.getColumns for 7.2 servers. This was accidentally broken in the previous release.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix a minor concurrency issue during the setup for processing escape functions. Thanks to Pierre Queinnec.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix DatabaseMetaData routines that return index information for a change in the 9.0 server that no longer renames the pg_attribute entries for the index, but only adjust the table's attributes on a column rename. Thanks to Adam Rauch.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Implement returning ASC/DESC order information in getIndexInfo.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Support PreparedStatement.setObject(int, Character). Thanks to Vitalii Tymchyshyn.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Track the tail of the SQLWarning chain so we can quickly add a new element to it instead of having to walk the entire chain from the head. This is important for the performance of handling plpgsql functions which do a ton of RAISE NOTICES which get translated into warnings. Thanks to Altaf Malik.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Remove an unused Sun specific import that prevented compilation on non-Sun JDKs. Thanks to Tom Lane.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Change the processing of Statement.executeUpdate to complain if any of the results of a multi-statement query string return a ResultSet. Previously we were only checking the first result which resulted in silent partial execution of later SELECT statements. Thanks to Joseph Shraibman.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Check that a Connection hasn't been closed before allowing any operations on it. Thanks to Kevin Grittner.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Don't allow rollback or commit when a Connection is in autocommit mode. Thanks to Kevin Grittner.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Support reading the new hex escaped bytea format.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add support for returning the new TRUNCATE privilege, that was added in 8.4, to the list of known table privileges. Thanks to Thomas Kellerer.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Change the SQLStates reported for using a closed Connection and closed ResultSet to be more consistent. Report connection_does_not_exist (08003) for a closed Connection and object_not_in_state (55000) for a ResultSet.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When a COPY operation is the first statement issued in a transaction, it was not sending the BEGIN necessary to start the transaction. Thanks to Maciek Sakrejda.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add the partial index constraint to the FILTER_CONDITION column returned by DatabaseMetaData.getIndexInfo. Thanks to Mark Kirkwood.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
The 8.4 release added some code to avoid re-describing a statement if we already had the type information available by copying the resolved type information from the query to the parameters. Its goal was just to overwrite parameters without a type (unknown), but it was actually overwriting all types which could change the query's desired behaviour. Thanks to Hiroshi Saito.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix the ORDINAL_POSITION in the DatabaseMetaData.getColumns. Previously we were returning simply pg_attribute.attnum, but that doesn't work in the presence of dropped columns because later columns don't get their attnum decremented if a preceding column is dropped. Instead use the row_number window function for 8.4 and later servers to figure out the live column position.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Always specify an XA error code when creating an XAException. Otherwise a transaction manager won't know what to do with the error and may have to assume the worst. Thanks to Heikki Linnakangas, Justin Bertram.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Japanese translation of error messages. Thanks to Hiroshi Saito.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Bulgarian translation of error messages. Thanks to Viktor Usunov.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
LOB truncation didn't allow truncating to zero length because it was improperly using the positioning length checks which don't allow a zero length. Thanks to Simon Kissane.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Protocol sync was lost when a batch statement parameter had an embedded null byte. Thanks to Pierre Queinnec.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix a problem using the Copy API to copy data to the server from a Reader. After reading data out of the Reader and into a buffer, we were sending the entire buffer on to the server, not just the subset of it that was filled by the read operation. Thanks to Leonardo F.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
A XA transaction should not change the autocommit setting of a Connection. Ensure that we restore this property correctly after the XA transaction completes. Thanks to Heikki Linnakangas, Achilleas Mantzios.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
PoolingDataSources were not picking up all of the properties that were set for them. Notably it would not give you a SSL connection when asked. Thanks to Eric Jain.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When setNull is called with a TIME or TIMESTAMP type we cannot pass that type information on to the backend because we really don't know whether it is with or without a time zone. For a NULL value it doesn't matter, but we can't establish a type because a later call with a non-null value using the same PreparedStatement can potentially end up using a specific type that is incorrect. Thanks to Martti Jeenicke.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add some more specific types to the return value for DatabaseMetaData.getTables. Return composite types, temporary views, and temporary sequences with TABLE_TYPE values specifically for them. Thanks to Thomas Kellerer.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add loglevel and protocolversion options to DataSources.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Remove an unused Sun specific import that prevented compilation on non-Sun JDKs. Thanks to Tom Lane.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Change the processing of Statement.executeUpdate to complain if any of the results of a multi-statement query string return a ResultSet. Previously we were only checking the first result which resulted in silent partial execution of later SELECT statements. Thanks to Joseph Shraibman.

item.description:

Add support for returning the new TRUNCATE privilege, that was added in 8.4, to the list of known table privileges. Thanks to Thomas Kellerer.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Don't list toast table types in the output of DatabaseMetaData.getTypeInfo.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add support for GSSAPI authentication.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
The Statement and Connection proxies used for connection pooling code relied on the underlying real connection and statement code for equals and hashcode support. When the proxies are closed we discard the references to the real objects, so we can't rely on them for this support because we'll get a NullPointerException. Thanks to Radu Buzila.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Implement support for generated keys for PreparedStatements in addition to the earlier support for plain Statements.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Not all datatypes use a comma for the array element delimiter. Lookup the appropriate delimiter in the system catalogs.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
DatabaseMetaData.getColumns was broken for the JDBC 3 and 4 drivers when running against 7.2 or older servers.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Retrieve columns' default values from pg_attrdef.adbin rather than adsrc because adsrc can get out of date when dependent objects are renamed while adbin stays up to date. Thanks to Dickson Guedes, Tom Lane.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Speed up parsing of BigDecimal values in the common case of reasonably short, simple numbers. Thanks to Heikki Linnakangas.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix parsing of integer and long data. Some malformed inputs (only a negative sign) got treated as valid data. Thanks to Heiiki Linnakangas.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Avoid sending extra Describe Portal messages to the server when we've already done this for the query. Caching the Field objects across executions will also speed up ResultSetMetaData calls. Thanks to Heiiki Linnakangas.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Avoid sending extra Describe Statement messages to the server when we've already done this for the query.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Initialize BatchUpdateExceptions with the SQLState of the SQLException that they are wrapping. Code that inspects the SQLStates of SQLExceptions, but doesn't unwrap the nested exception will not understand the underlying cause and may make incorrect decisions about the severity of the error. Thanks to Fujii Masao.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Updated Serbian translation. Thanks to Bojan Skaljac.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Updated Brazilian Portuguese translation. Thanks to Euler Taveira de Oliveira.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Updated Turkish translation. Thanks to Devrim Gunduz.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add a connection parameter for setting a socket read timeout. This acts like a global query timeout that shuts down the connection if exceeded. This can be used to detect dead network connections if you can reasonably estimate the upper bound of your queries. Thanks to Art Gramlich.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Initialize the prepareThreshold parameter for datasources to the same value that would be used by a non-DataSource created connection. By not setting it, it effectively turned off the use of named statements.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Provide a way for the user to specify the desired length return value for metadata about types of unknown length. We've tried a number of things and can't keep everyone happy, so it's their problem now.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Implement support for COPY in the JDBC driver with a non-standard postgresql CopyManager API. This provides support for both copy from the server and to the server and operating in either a source or sink mode. Thanks to Kalle Hallivuori.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
The Statement and Connection proxies used for connection pooling code relied on the underlying real connection and statement code for equals and hashcode support. When the proxies are closed we discard the references to the real objects, so we can't rely on them for this support because we'll get a NullPointerException. Thanks to Radu Buzila.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
DatabaseMetaData.getColumns was broken for the JDBC 3 and 4 drivers when running against 7.2 or older servers.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Retrieve columns' default values from pg_attrdef.adbin rather than adsrc because adsrc can get out of date when dependent objects are renamed while adbin stays up to date. Thanks to Dickson Guedes, Tom Lane.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix parsing of integer and long data. Some malformed inputs (only a negative sign) got treated as valid data. Thanks to Heiiki Linnakangas.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Initialize BatchUpdateExceptions with the SQLState of the SQLException that they are wrapping. Code that inspects the SQLStates of SQLExceptions, but doesn't unwrap the nested exception will not understand the underlying cause and may make incorrect decisions about the severity of the error. Thanks to Fujii Masao.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
The Statement and Connection proxies used for connection pooling code relied on the underlying real connection and statement code for equals and hashcode support. When the proxies are closed we discard the references to the real objects, so we can't rely on them for this support because we'll get a NullPointerException. Thanks to Radu Buzila.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Make the build system aware of the 1.7 JDK (which icedtea reports itself as) and add an explicit check and complaint if we find a JDK that we don't support.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Do comparison of identifiers in a known Locale (specificially US). In Turkish for example "id".toLowerCase().equals("ID".toLowerCase()) is false which makes looking up a column name case insensitively a problem. Thanks to Mikko Tiihonen.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Avoid making a copy of the current row after each positioning command, for example next(). This is only needed if we have an updatable ResultSet and is just a waste otherwise. Thanks to Gustav Trede.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix a deadlock that occurs when retrieving notifications. Normal query execution enters the QueryExecutor monitor and then calls a synchronized method in the ProtocolConnection to update the transaction state. Notification retrieval operates in the reverse order, entering the ProtocolConnection monitor and then calling a synchronized method in the QueryExecutor.
Remove the QueryExecutor call from ProtocolConnection and make the higher level code responsible for calling it so we always acquire locks in the same order. Thanks to Joao Rui Leal.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
CallableStatement#getUpdateCount was returning 1 when a function returned a ResultSet. Return -1 instead. Thanks to Sam Lawrence, Albe Laurenz.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
The DataSource options for ssl where not correctly being serialized or included in the Reference.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add a configuration option to enable tcp keep alives. Thanks to Toru Shimogaki.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Refactor type information functions into a dedicated interface. This avoids making BaseConnection expose these and AbstractJdbc2Connection just proxy these to the real type information handing. Additionally now type information can be setup differently for each JDBC version which will be required for things like SQLXML support because the JDBC2 code can't use the java.sql.Types values for JDBC4.
This removes the long deprecated functions in the public PGConnection interface, but hopefully no one is still using that.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
DatabaseMetaData.getTypeInfo provides two columns for indicating the prefix and suffix that should be wrapped around a literal when putting it into a query. Return the correct quoting (') for all non-numeric types. Thanks to Mats Ekelund.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
For array types, return information about their base types for things like getPrecision.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Accept UTF8 as an equivalent of UNICODE when trying to detect if client_encoding has changed to something the driver doesn't understand. Don't try to accept every possible spelling (UTF-8) as UTF8 is the server's canonical name and people shouldn't be messing with this anyway.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Updated German translation. Thanks to Andre Bialojahn.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add more detail to the exception when interpreting a server error message. Thanks to Daniel Migowski.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Make datasources support the compatible parameter. Thanks to Achilleas Mantzios.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Send initial connection startup parameters in UTF-8 rather than US-ASCII. The initial connection encoding is poorly defined as "whatever encoding the database is in" which we don't know until after the authentication phase is complete. UTF-8 supports everything ascii did and will now allow database names, user names, and passwords to contain non-ascii characters as long as their database is in UTF-8, which is the most common case.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Avoid looking up the UTF-8 Charset by name. When using multiple Charsets, this is a minor performance hit in the single threaded case and a big point of contention for multiple threads. Thanks to Paul Lindner.

item.title: MyProject remove
item.description:
remove by jurka :
Kill off JDBC2 specific code. Simplify the build system now that we require a 1.4 or higher JDK.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Map the database uuid type to java.util.UUID. This only works for relatively new server (8.3) and JDK (1.5) versions.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Change the output of PreparedStatement.toString for V3 protocol connections to output a textual representation of the query that is a legal query in most cases. Previously it didn't quote or escape parameters. It still doesn't correctly handle binary data and it may not be exactly the same as executing it by the PreparedStatement (which will have extra type information), but it is a nicer to work with. Thanks to Michael Enke.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Implement support for SQLXML. All of the underlying XML tools don't seem to support handling fragments, but these are allowed in the server xml type. I'm also not sure there aren't any encoding problems, but it mostly seems to work.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Adjust the deadlock avoidance code for the V3 protocol to be concerned with many statements in a single execute call in addition to the existing worry about many statements from an executeBatch call. This doesn't prevent all possible deadlocks as the deadlock avoidance calculation was written for batch execution which should not be returning ResultSets. If many long queries that return significant results are issued with a single execute we will still deadlock.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
DatabaseMetaData.getTypeInfo was reporting whether the type was signed or not, but the output column is really supposed to indicate whether the the type is unsigned or not. Thanks to Mythili Gopalakrishnan.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Implement basic generated keys support. It does not support returning columns by index because that requires complicated parsing of the query to determine the table being used. Right now it supports returning all columns and columns by name.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Support a parameter (?) for the amount part of the timestampadd function. Previously we only supported literals. Thanks to Christophe Janton.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Make the build system aware of the 1.7 JDK (which icedtea reports itself as) and add an explicit check and complaint if we find a JDK that we don't support.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
When PreparedStatement.setObject(int, Object, Types.OTHER) is issued, bind the String version of the object with an unspecified type. This makes it easier to use types that Java doesn't have a mapping for without enabling stringtype=unspecified for all driver calls. Thanks to Matt Magoffin.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Implement the new JDBC3 + JDBC4 columns that are now returned by DatabaseMetaData.getColumns. Thanks to Christian Schroder.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
The JDBC spec says that when you have two duplicately named columns in a ResultSet, a search by name should return the first one. Previously our code was returning the second match. Thanks to Magne Mahre.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Throw an exception if people try to use setQueryTimeout with a non-zero value as it is not implemented.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
While the driver currently doesn't support the copy protocol, it needs to understand it enough to ignore it. Now the connection will not be irreparably broken when a COPY request is sent. Thanks to Altaf Malik.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Updated simplified and traditional Chinese translations. Thanks to Kuo ChaoYi.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Updated Brazilian Portuguese translation. Thanks to Euler Taveira de Oliveira.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Updated Turkish translation. Thanks to Devrim Gunduz.

item.description:
fix by davec :
Fix batch execution of CallableStatements.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When doing batch execution we can have multiple Parse and DescribeStatement messages on the wire at the same time. When we finally get around to collecting the DescribeStatement results we must check whether they still apply to the currently parsed query. Otherwise we'll overwrite our type information with stale data that will cause failures down the line. Thanks to Eric Faulhaber.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Provide a minimal ClientInfo implementation because of complaints about exceptions continually being thrown on glassfish.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Set extra_float_digits=2 on connection startup so we get as much data about floats as possible.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Assorted cleanups to the source tree based on findbugs output. Thanks to Mikko Tiihonen.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
CallableStatements with OUT parameters that get executed more than prepareThreshold times failed if clearParameters() was called in between executions. When we've hit the prepareThreshold, we no longer send Parse messages which invoke SimpleParameterList.getTypeOID which has side effects required to setup the parameters correctly. Add an explicit convertFunctionOutParameters method to do this work instead that we call in all execution paths. Thanks to Ludovico Bianchini.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
The driver was incorrectly parsing identifiers that had parts that look like dollar quotes. Things like a$b$c are valid identifiers, not dollar quotes. When determining if a $ we've found is a dollar quote start, look at the preceding character and see if it is a valid identifier part to determine if we're in the midst of an identifier or are starting a new token. Thanks to Michael Paesold.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Multiple calls to XAConnection.getConnection within the same user transaction ended up restarting the transaction on the server side as a result of manipulating the autocommit state. When retrieving a Connection, we must pay attention to whether a user transaction is in progress when setting the autocommit state. Thanks to Heikki Linnakangas.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Make code that parses queries for updateable resultsets aware of the ONLY clause. Thanks to Oleg Vasylenko.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Support multi-dimensional arrays and returning arrays of primitive server types as wrapped java Objects so that NULL values can be detected. Backwards compatibility is provided using the compatible=8.2 URL option to return arrays of primitive types. Thanks to Marek Lewczuk.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
While custom type maps are not implemented, the code to detect the caller trying to use them threw a ClassCastException. Correctly detect the attempted use of custom types and bail out with a SQLException.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Implement the JDBC4 method Connection.createArrayOf. Now people can portably and easily handle array data.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When dealing with OIDs larger than 2^31 we can't retrieve these as Java ints. Using long throughout the driver would be a pain, one reason is that you can't use a switch on a long variable. PG supports representing OIDs as signed ints (select '3000000000'::oid::int4), so retrieve the values as longs, but then cast to int to get the signed representation. Thanks to Tom Lane, Quinton Dolan.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
While custom type maps are not implemented, the code to detect the caller trying to use them threw a ClassCastException. Correctly detect the attempted use of custom types and bail out with a SQLException.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Brazilian Portuguese translation update. Thanks to Euler Taveira de Oliveira.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
French translation update. Thanks to Xavier Poinsard.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Empty finalize method still has a performance impact, so comment it out entirely. Thanks to Mikko Tiihonen.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Make inner classes static where possible. Thanks to Mikko Tiihonen.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Updatable ResultSets did not work when updating bytea data and then retrieving it because we send the data to the server in binary format, but the ResultSet was expecting to read it in text format. So we need to convert the data from binary to text format before stuffing it into the ResultSet. Thanks to Mikko Tiihonen.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
ResultSet.updateNClob(String, Reader) goes into an infinite loop. It really meant to call updateNClob(int, Reader), but was calling itself instead. Thanks to Mikko Tiihonen.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add SSL as an option for DataSources. Thanks to Albe Laurenz.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Do escape processing on batch Statements prior to execution. This already worked for PreparedStatements, but not plain Statements. Thanks to Hui Ye.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Don't return quotes around identifiers in the results of DatabaseMetaData.getIndexInfo even if they would require quoting in SQL. Thanks to Andrei Badea.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add the proper META-INF entry for the driver jar file so that JDBC4 applications no longer have to say Class.forName() as the driver gets loaded automatically.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Change how PGobject and children support clone(), to get more reasonable behavior when extending these classes. Don't implement clone by calling the constructor because you get the wrong class when cloning a subclass. Thanks to Russell Francis.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Pull the default login timeout from DriverManager.getLoginTimeout() if none has been specified as a URL parameter. Thanks to Adrian Custer.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add support for returning function parameter names and directions to getProcedureColumns. Thanks to Jeffrey Cox.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When retrieving the columns of a function that returns a complex type, don't retrieve system columns (like xmin/xmax/...) that you'll find if the type is from a table.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
The previous fix to try and set a XA based Connection's autocommit property correctly didn't quite work. Calling XAConnection.getConnection set autocommit to true even if we already had a transaction in progress. Thanks to Luca Ferrari, Heikki Linnakangas.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Serbian translation updates. Thanks to Bojan Skaljac.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Make setObject recognize a parameter of type java.lang.Byte. Thanks to Boom Roos.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Error message was reporting the wrong parameter type value in the V3 protocol's SimpleParameterList implementation. Thanks to Nathan Keynes.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by davec :
Allow CallableStatements to use batch execution.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Explicitly state which source level we are compiling. Newer versions of gij/gcj run a 1.5 VM, but default to a 1.4 source level compile which tricks up our build system. This still doens't fix the case of running with a newer VM than compiler, but I don't see what we can do about that. Thanks to Tom Lane, Oliver Jowett.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Backpatch fix to 8.1: Allow XAResource.start with TMJOIN in a limited set of circumstances to work with WebLogic. We allow TMJOIN only if the resource was previously ended and the Xid is the same as the current Xid. Thanks to Jan de Visser and Heikki Linnakangas.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Backpatch fix to 8.1: A XAConnections default autocommit state should be true. The driver was previously setting autocommit to false and assuming it would stay that way. This caused two problems. First, some applications expected to be able to issue local autocommit transactions prior to begin(). Second, some TMs (Geronimo) set the autocommit state to true themselves, which causes problems as the driver did not expect it to be changed. This patch correctly disables and enables autocommit around begin, prepare, commit, and rollback methods. Thanks to Allan Saddi.

This still doens't fix the case of running with a newer VM than compiler, but I don't see what we can do about that. Thanks to Tom Lane, Oliver Jowett.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Statement.getTime, .getDate, and .getTimestamp methods which are passed a Calendar object were rotating the timezone in the wrong direction. Rewrite this code to use the existing TimestampUtils methods to match the working code in ResultSets. Thanks to Ravi Periasmy.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Initial Serbian translation. Thanks to Bojan Skaljac.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Produce the timezone that we send to the server in the same format that we can parse. This is important for updatable ResultSets as we must be able to parse the format we produce. Thanks to Leon Do.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Make the default object return type of oids to be a Java Long instead of Integer because oids are unsigned and exceed the range of Integer.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Make Large Object handling work when the oid counter has exceeded Integer.MAX_VALUE by handling oids as longs.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Implement the JDBC4 Blob/Clob free method.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Allow multiple streams on the same large object to be used in parallel by assigning each stream its own large object handle.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix persistence of XA datasources. PGObjectFactory wasn't aware of PGXADataSource and can't be because of the requirements for different build versions. Add a new PGXADataSourceFactory to provide this functionality. Thanks to Heikki Linnakangas.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Improve performance of PGStream code by reducing function call and casting overhead. Thanks to Stephen Denne, Nelson Arape.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by davec :
Close ref cursors immediately after fetching the rows. In long running transactions leaving them open results in memory consumption. Thanks to Guillaume Smet.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix the error message generated by a CallableStatement not getting results that match the registered out parameters to report the correct parameter position.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Replace ad-hoc and missing identifier escaping with a utility method.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Implement large object truncation for 8.3 servers. Currently we truncate Clobs with a byte length instead of a character length until we figure out how to represent character sets in Clobs.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Interval formatting didn't work for negative seconds values greater than -1. It would format it as -.5, but interval input doesn't accept this, so write it as -0.5 instead.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Change DatabaseMetaData.getSearchStringEscape to always return "\\" instead of "\\\\". Previously it was assuming that it would be fed directly into a query and it needed to escape itself for the backend's input parser. This doesn't work for things like PreparedStatement parameters or DatabaseMetaData methods that take patterns. Thanks to Valery Meshkov.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add methods to PGInterval to combine and scale intervals.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Remove mapping of the rand escape function. Due to the change in the setseed backend function return value from int to void we cannot implement in the same way as for previous server versions. Also per discussion the old implementation looked wrong and the spec gives us very little insight into what it should actually do.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Allow updatable ResultSets to update arrays. Thanks to Vasylenko.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
In an error message reporting an unparseable timestamp value the code was trying to put the unparseable portion into the error message, but used the wrong variable to get the correct length.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Parse timezones that have offsets in seconds. 8.2 servers now return this information so we must be able to handle it.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Save JUnit output into files so they can be processed by tools. The given example is the Hudson CI tool, but it's likely that other tools also need a file to work on. Thanks to Frank Spies.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Implement ResultSet.updateArray by simply mapping it to updateObject which now works for arrays.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Make the driver build under the 1.6 JDK.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Italian translation update. Thanks to Giuseppe Sacco.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Brazilian Portuguese translation update. Thanks to Euler Taveira de Oliveira.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When issuing multiple queries on one statement the driver was not clearing some intermediate state between executions. When an update, insert, or delete followed a select, the select's results were still available and would be returned instead of the non-query's affected row count. Thanks to Gilles Rayrat.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When the driver asks the server to resolve a type the resolved type is stored in the SimpleQuery object. When the statement is executed again the driver determines whether the existing types match or if it needs to be re-prepared by comparing the current Statement's settings with the SimpleQuery. The Statement will have the unspecified oid while the SimpleQuery will have the resolved oid, so there will not be a match and the statement will needlessly be re-prepared. Allow an unspecified oid to match any resolved type. Thanks to Akira Sato.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When creating a ResultSet from a refcursor, respect the creating ResultSet's scrollability setting. The way the ResultSet is created means that it will always be scrollable anyway, so there's no downside. We cannot support updatable refcursor ResultSets until we get updatable cursors.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix a bug in function escape processing. When dealing with an invalid escape the code attempted to read until it hit the escape end and press on, but it forgot to increment its position counter. This lead to an infinite loop that eventually resulted in an out of memory error.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Update the documentation to reflect the fact that the default prepareThreshold is five, not zero.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Reduce memory usage when bytea data is retrieved from ResultSet.getBytes by using an extra pass over the data to determine the output buffer size ahead of time. Thanks to Luis Vilar Flores.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Improve performance when retrieving large ResultSets consisting of Strings, ints, and longs. Improve String retrieval by avoiding a copy from the network buffer and using it directly to create the String instance. Improve integer retrieval by using a custom byte to number conversion that uses knowledge of the encoding to avoid creating an intermediate String representation first. Thanks to Mikko Tiihonen.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add support for parsing dollar quotes and comments. Thanks to Michael Paesold.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Improve handling of incorrectly written user code using CallableStatements. Defend against trying to retrieve data before the statement is executed.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Adjust precision returned by meta data methods to reflect the latest javadocs additional documentation.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Correct error message in CallableStatement to identify the mismatch with the registered return type.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Improve the performance of getBoolean for false values by explicitly checking for false rather than generating a NumberFormatException. Thanks to Eberhard Schulte.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Correct escaping of named savepoints which follow identifier, not literal rules. Thanks to Michael Paesold.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Make the driver operate correctly when standard_conforming_strings is on. Thanks to Michael Paesold.

XAConnections default autocommit state should be true. The driver was previously setting autocommit to false and assuming it would stay that way. This caused two problems. Second, some TMs (Geronimo) set the autocommit state to true themselves, which causes problems as the driver did not expect it to be changed. item.description:
fix by jurka :
Correct escaping of named savepoints which follow identifier, not literal rules. Thanks to Michael Paesold.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Using callable statements against older server versions (7.4 or 8.0) did not work because of recent changes to output parameter handling. 7.4 and 8.0 do not support function output parameters, but they still must support the functions return value. Every function must have either a return value or an output parameter so we force the minimum output parameter count to one.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Remove documentation's claim that we don't support functions with out parameters.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Updated German translation. Thanks to Andre Bialojahn.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Using callable statements against older server versions (7.4 or 8.0) did not work because of recent changes to output parameter handling. 7.4 and 8.0 do not support function output parameters, but they still must support the functions return value. Every function must have either a return value or an output parameter so we force the minimum output parameter count to one.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When running against a 8.1+ server with protocol version 2 we cannot handle output parameters and can only handle the traditional function return value.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Remove documentation's claim that we don't support functions with out parameters.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Updated German translation. Thanks to Andre Bialojahn.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
A bad merge of out of memory detection and zero testing resulted in incorrectly handing of null values. Thanks to Glenn Holmer.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by davec :
Fix a couple of bugs in CallableStatement outputs. An oversight in the checking of actual results vs. what the caller specified for registerOutParameter was checking all register parameters against the first out parameter, not the parameter it actually corresponded with.
Also with a function that has an in parameter and an out parameter, the out parameter will be registered at position 2, but will be returned in a result at position 1 because the first input parameter generates no output. The driver needs to correctly map between these two parameter offsets. Thanks to Luis Londono.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Error messages were not run through MessageFormat if it didn't have any parameters. This was a problem because all error messages are written expecting to be run through the formatter and use two single quotes when only one is desired in the output. Without being run through the formatter the two quotes appeared in the output. Thanks to Giuseppe Sacco.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Updated German translation. Thanks to Andre Bialojahn.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Add some more synchronization to the TypeInfoCache. We need synchronization around the PreparedStatements because they may not be used by two threads at the same time. Additional synchronization is applied to the maps to ensure that they are in sync with each other. Make _pgNameToSQLType static. Thanks to Till Toenges.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add a protocolVersion parameter to the test suite runner. This allows testing the V2 protocol path on newer server versions. Also fix tests that were incorrectly using the server version for protocol version dependent results. To give it a try, just add protocolVersion=2 to your build.local.properties.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
An OutOfMemoryError during fe<->be communication leaves the protocol in an unknown state. This prevents the caller from even closing the connection. Checking every allocation is a lot of work, but the most likely error location is going to be when receiving large result sets. Put in checks around receiving row data to detect memory exhaustion, keep the protocol in a known state, and report the failure back to the user. Thanks to David Blasby.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When we're unable to parse a timestamp value, the error message should print out the bad value. It was printing a char array which showed up as a useless [C@xxxx. Thanks to Oliver Jowett.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
gij/gcj has some JDK1.5 classes in it, but it only supports JDK1.4 as the default source level. This confuses older ant versions and our build script tries to compile a JDK1.5 version. Instead of letting ant detect the java version, let the jvm tell us that itself using java.specification.version as suggested by Heikki Linnakangas. Also put in a check for a JDK1.6 compile attempt and bail out with an explanatory unsupported error message instead of just failing at some random point.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When a prepared statement uses different parameter types than what the statement was originally prepared for, the driver must replan the query for the new types. When doing this in batches the driver was not correctly freeing old plans.
To cleanup prepared statements the driver records a reference to a query object in response to the ParseComplete message. The problem in this case was that since the driver sends multiple Parse messages before a Sync, when the driver receives the first ParseComplete message the query object now contains a reference to the latest parsed statement, not the first. So it was only cleaning up the last parsed statement not all of them. Thanks to Peter Eisentraut.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When the Connection retrieved from XAConnection.getConnection() is closed we do not want to rollback the transaction because the underlying connection is not closed and the transaction is being managed by the XAResource, not the Connection. Thanks to Niels Beekman.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by davec :
Add escape sequences for timestamp addition and difference. Thanks to Xavier Poinsard.

The driver needs to correctly map between these two parameter offsets. Thanks to Luis Londono.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Statement.cancel was prone to race conditions even with a single threaded client. It would fire off a cancel message without waiting for an acknowledgement of its success. This resulted in future queries being cancelled when the cancel message was received by the backend. Ensure we get an EOF from the server before returning from the cancel call. This still does nothing about multi-threaded race conditions. Thanks to Oliver Jowett.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Remove the length argument from Field constructor for manually created Fields. The length was inconsistently and incorrectly used and it is of little to us, so don't clutter things up by requiring one.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Unify type metadata functions in TypeInfoCache. Previously ResultSetMetaData and DatabaseMetaData had their own inconsistent versions of these. Do not use pg_type.typlen when calculating display sizes. The backend storage size is unlikely to relate to the textual display size of a datatype. Add information for some more types interval, bit, varbit and do some recalculation of the display sizes for numeric, time, and timestamp datetypes.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Italian translation updates. Thanks to Giuseppe Sacco.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Update getObject and getArray methods that take a map to only bail out with a not implemented exception if the supplied map is not null and not empty. Apparently Sun's WebRowSet implementation passes empty Maps to these methods. Thanks to Gunnar Stefansson.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by davec :
Fix the parameter indexing on CallableStatements that do not return any parameters.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
The V2 protocol wasn't correctly handling EmptyQuery messages. It expected a four byte message length after the EmptyQuery message, but there is only a single null byte sent by the backend.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Brazilian Portuguese translation updates. Thanks to Euler Taveira de Oliveira.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When performing replace processing we must continue processing until we hit the end of a user supplied query, not just once we've detected the end of a valid query. Consider the example: SELECT a FROM t WHERE (1>0)) ORDER BY a; We must send the whole query to the backend, not just the section before the last closing parenthesis. Thanks to Senden Kris.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
escapeQuotes() in DatabaseMetaData was not correctly handling backslashes which would result in incorrect searches and has the potential for a SQL injection attack. Thanks to Paolo Predonzani.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
The TypeInfoCache had a static Map for the pg type name to java.sql.Types conversion, but it was being reinitialized for each new Connection. Even though its content is static make this an instance variable for simplicity. Thanks to Till Toenges.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Correct the display size calculations for numeric data. Don't add precision and scale because scale is just a subset of precision.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
DatabaseMetaData.getTables should return all table type if passed null as for the types array. It was previously returning only those tables that psql's \d command would for a null type filter. Thanks to Thomas Kellerer.

item.description:
by jurka :
Add scale information for time/timestamp/interval to DatabaseMetaData.getColumns. Include knowledge of interval in ResultSetMetaData.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add a URL parameter to enable logging of Connections which are finalized, but not closed. This will help people debug leaks. Thanks to rupa.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Adjust ResultSetMetaData.getColumnDisplaySize to return Integer.MAX_VALUE instead of -1 for variable length fields.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Correct the display size calculations for numeric data. Don't add precision and scale because scale is just a subset of precision.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by oliver :
Strip out call tracing debugging from DatabaseMetaData -- it is only half there, and it isn't really much use for debugging the driver. There are better approaches for tracing application calls into the driver, e.g. JTrace. Update comments. Update what the metadata claims in a couple of places: getMaxStatements() returns 0 -- we are only limited by heap size, not by e.g. a hard limit on the number of simultaneous statements on the DB side - supportsMultipleResultSets() returns true -- we support multiple results from execute(), e.g. multiple SELECT statements in one query.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by oliver :
Debug logging overhaul: Support for setting loglevel when running tests. Tests log to a separate file to avoid making ant run out of heap. Misc test tweaks to play nicely with logging. Add a Logger class that handles logging a per-connection ID and timestamp on each log line. There is one Logger instance per Connection, and one for the Driver itself. Rearrange per-connection initialization of log levels so it only affects logging on that one particular connection. Default log levels are taken from whatever is specified in the defaults property file, or the current driver-wide loglevel if no default is present. The driver-wide log level is also take from the default property file unless explicitly overridden by Driver.setLogLevel().

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by oliver :
Add a new parameter 'stringtype' (values 'varchar' or 'unspecified') to control how parameters set via setString() are bound. Fix V3 parameter logic so that prepared statements are not reused when a non-NULL UNSPECIFIED parameter is set over the top of a previous parameter.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by oliver :
Break most of AbstractJdbc2ResultSet.findColumn out into a separate findColumnIndex() method that does not throw if the column isn't found. Use that method directly in isUpdateable() when looking for the OID column to avoid creating/throwing/catching/discarding an exception unnecessarily. Clean up redundant try/catch and unnecessary nesting in updateRow(). Thanks to Kevin Grittner.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
DatabaseMetaData.getTables should return all table type if passed null as for the types array. It was previously returning only those tables that psql's \d command would for a null type filter. Thanks to Thomas Kellerer.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Brazilian Portuguese translation updates. Thanks to Euler Taveira de Oliveira.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Turkish translation updates. Thanks to Nicolai Tufar.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When formatting an interval value as text, override the system locale settings for DecimalFormat. We always want to use '.' as the decimal separator regardless of locale because that's what the server expects.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When I added bounds checking for ResultSet.updateXXX methods, I accidentally removed bounds checking for getXXX methods. This resulted in an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException being thrown instead of the desired SQLException.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
The driver needs to break a statement into individual queries to use the V3 extended query protocol. The parsing code did not recognize multiple rule actions separated by semi-colons as one query. Thanks to Jolly Chen.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by davec :
Improve performance of locating placeholders in queries. Thanks to Sergei Rogovskiy.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:

Improve performance of timestamp and currency parsing. Thanks to Ken Geis.

XADataSource implementation. Thanks to Heikki Linnakangas.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Fix a multitude of timestamp, timezone, and Calendar problems resulting from the mismatch of Java's Timestamp object and the SQL specs timestamp with and without time zone datatypes.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
getWarnings() should throw a SQLException if called on a closed Statement.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Make callable statements work again for JDK 1.5 builds. Any code in the jdbc3/Jdbc3 classes also needs to get into the corresponding jdbc3g/Jdbc3g class.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Every execution of a Statement clears the warning chain from the previous execution. This was causing a memory leak by endlessly chaining warnings together that should have been discarded. Thanks to Albe Laurenz.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Fix updateRow() involving Date, Time, or Timestamp.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Initial Czech translation. Thanks to Petr Dittrich.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add the Detail: field to the default error message string. This is often includes valuable information that shouldn't require adjusting the loglevel to receive.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Remove direct manipulation of org.postgresql.Driver.logDebug in tests for no apparent reason.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Adjust DatabaseMetaData.getCatalogs to only return the current connection's catalog. PG doesn't support multiple catalogs on a single connection and making this information available only confuses people and applications. Per discussion of Jan 2004.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Map setObject calls for Types.BLOB, CLOB, and ARRAY to call the related setXXX method if we don't need to do any conversion. Thanks to Marc Herbert.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
8.1 servers store interval day and hour information separately, so we have to be prepared for more than two digits worth of hour data. Also pre-7.4 servers do not return second information if it is zero, so we cannot parse this field unless it is actually there. Thanks to Jean-Pierre Pelletier.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Add checks to prevent ResultSet.updateXXX methods from throwing an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException. We should only throw SQLExceptions from here.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
ResultSet.getObject().getClass().getName() should match up with ResultSetMetaData.getColumnClassName(). This wasn't true for the java.sql.Types.SMALLINT case. Thanks to Karl von Randow.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Make setObject(int, Object) aware of the Blob, Clob, and Array types when trying to infer the incoming object type. Thanks to Marc Herbert.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Every execution of a Statement clears the warning chain from the previous execution. This was causing a memory leak by endlessly chaining warnings together that should have been discarded. Thanks to Albe Laurenz.
