add by jurka :
Initial Czech translation. Thanks to Petr Dittrich.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Map setObject calls for Types.BLOB, CLOB, and ARRAY to call the related setXXX method if we don't need to do any conversion. Thanks to Marc Herbert.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Add checks to prevent ResultSet.updateXXX methods from throwing an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException. We should only throw SQLExceptions from here.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
ResultSet.getObject().getClass().getName() should match up with ResultSetMetaData.getColumnClassName(). This wasn't true for the java.sql.Types.SMALLINT case. Thanks to Karl von Randow.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Make setObject(int, Object) aware of the Blob, Clob, and Array types when trying to infer the incoming object type. Thanks to Marc Herbert.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by oliver :
Support asynchronous notifications by looking for pending messages when getNotifications() is called. Doesn't always pick up on them (it depends if the underlying socket input stream implements available()) but it's better than the status quo. Thanks to Andras Kadinger.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by davec :
Fixed problem with calendar being modified in setDate, setTimestamp.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Improve null handling. Allow setNull(1, Types.XXX) for ARRAY, NULL, DISTINCT, and STRUCT by mapping them to the unknown oid. Make setArray, setBlob, setClob, and setCharacterStream accept null parameters.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
In 8.1 index_max_keys != func_max_args which broke the code for determining index_max_keys and retreiving foreign key information. Use the GUC variable max_index_keys and pg_catalog.generate_series instead of inspecting typlens and using information_schema._pg_keypositions.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Make PGInterval useful instead of just a placeholder by providing access to the individual fields. Thanks to Oliver Siegmar.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Allow jdbc2-optional and jdbc3 test suites to be run on their own (with a suitably adjusted build.xml). They depended on the jdbc2 tests being run to load the driver for them.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
In Blob.getBytes(long position, int length) position is an offset starting at 1, not zero as the driver was previously doing. Thanks to Emmanuel Bernard.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Add a test case to detect if we modify a passed in Calendar object to things like PreparedStatement.setTimestamp. This shows the fix for setDate had an error and that the corresponding ResultSet.get methods had the same problems.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Remove redundant javadoc comments (getter/setter methods don't need @param @return tags). Many of which caused warnings because of mismatches between @param and the actual parameter name.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Simplified Chineses translation. Thanks to Weiping.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Brazilian translation updates. Thanks to Euler Taveira de Oliveira.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Polish translation updates. Thanks to Jaroslaw Pyszny.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Update comments for getExtraNameCharacters to describe why we can't list all the possible valid ones.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by davec :
Added conversions for cts tests.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Java message format strings need to double 's.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Italian translation updates. Thanks to Giuseppe Sacco.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Fix ResultSet.getObject(..., Types.SMALLINT) to return an Integer per the JDBC3 typemapping appendix. Add support for several more types to ResultSet.getObject: BOOLEAN, TINYINT, DECIMAL, LONGVARCHAR, LONGVARBINARY, CLOB, BLOB. Thanks to Kevin Grittner.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by davec :
CallableStatmentTest.getShort will only work with v3 protocol exposed the protocol version to AbstractJdbc2Connection, utility method in TestUtil to enable/disable tests based on protocol version.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Check the pg_input buffer, as well as the socket itself, when looking for pending async notifies -- otherwise we only report the first of a batch of notifies until more data comes along.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by oliver :
Move the custom UTF-8 decoder into a subclass of Encoding. Add support to the UTF-8 decoder for Unicode code points above U+FFFF represented as a surrogate pair in Java). These values can be generated by the backend from 8.1. The reverse path is already handled by the JVM's own UTF-8 encoder. Add a number of unicode encode/decode tests to make sure it's all working.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by davec :
Modifications to pass JDBC CTS. Added test cases which are essentially the same as the CTS to make sure we continue to pass it.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Improve null handling. Allow setNull(1, Types.XXX) for ARRAY, NULL, DISTINCT, and STRUCT by mapping them to the unknown oid. Make setArray, setBlob, setClob, and setCharacterStream accept null parameters.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
In Blob.getBytes(long position, int length) position is an offset starting at 1, not zero as the driver was previously doing. Thanks to Emmanuel Bernard.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Add a test case to detect if we modify a passed in Calendar object to things like PreparedStatement.setTimestamp. This shows the fix for setDate had an error and that the corresponding ResultSet.get methods had the same problems.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Simplified Chineses translation. Thanks to Weiping.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Brazilian translation updates. Thanks to Euler Taveira de Oliveira.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Polish translation updates. Thanks to Jaroslaw Pyszny.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Fix ResultSet.getObject(..., Types.SMALLINT) to return an Integer per the JDBC3 typemapping appendix. Add support for several more types to ResultSet.getObject: BOOLEAN, TINYINT, DECIMAL, LONGVARCHAR, LONGVARBINARY, CLOB, BLOB. Thanks to Kevin Grittner.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Java message format strings need to double 's.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Italian translation updates. Thanks to Giuseppe Sacco.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by davec :
CallableStatmentTest.getShort will only work with v3 protocol exposed the protocol version to AbstractJdbc2Connection, utility method in TestUtil to enable/disable tests based on protocol version.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by oliver :
Implement basic login timeout support via a 'loginTimeout' URL parameter.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
SQLWarning.getMessage wasn't reporting the message from a Notice message in the V3 protocol. Make the V2 and V3 cases return a consistent message and add a test.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Restore the ability for the JDBC driver to map infinite timestamp values by using special constants in PGStatement. The original implementation was removed for being arbitrary and unidirectional. Thanks to Oliver Siegmar.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add method names to the not implemented exception to allow unhelpful client programs that don't provide a stacktrace to be debugged. Thanks to Xavier Poinsard.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Support setNull(x, Types.BLOB) and CLOB, reported by Tore Halset. Thanks to Tore Halset.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Avoid generating garbage byte[0] objects that we immediately discard in ReceiveTupleV2 / ReceiveTupleV3. Also some minor rearrangements to avoid an unnecessary assignment in the null case. This gives a small performance improvement. Thanks to Ken Geis.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Get DatabaseMetaData.getIndexInfo to return useful data for functional indexes. Return the expression used for the column name. Thanks to Peter Royal.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When moveToCurrentRow is called and the current row is off the end of the ResultSet we can't try to load that row because it doesn't exist and will throw an Exception. Thanks to Prasanth.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Implement JDBC 3 Blob methods to allow writing. Thanks to Michael Barker.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Make all the fields of a server error message available.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Put all type info handling into a separate file. This links oids, pg type names, sql types, and java class names together. Use this information to implement ParameterMetaData's getParameterClassName.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
SQLWarning.getMessage wasn't reporting the message from a Notice message in the V3 protocol. Make the V2 and V3 cases return a consistent message and add a test.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Restore the ability for the JDBC driver to map infinite timestamp values by using special constants in PGStatement. The original implementation was removed for being arbitrary and unidirectional. Thanks to Oliver Siegmar.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add method names to the not implemented exception to allow unhelpful client programs that don't provide a stacktrace to be debugged. Thanks to Xavier Poinsard.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Support setNull(x, Types.BLOB) and CLOB, reported by Tore Halset. Thanks to Tore Halset.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When moveToCurrentRow is called and the current row is off the end of the ResultSet we can't try to load that row because it doesn't exist and will throw an Exception. Thanks to Prasanth.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Ensure PSQLWarning is Serializable.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Bugfixes and tests for two date-related bugs:
The jdbc escaped scalar function dayofweek should return values between 1 and 7 (1 for sunday) unlike the backend "extract dow" function which is zero-based.
The literal escaped values for date/time/timestamp were not explicitly casted which causes some problems. For example: extract( dow from '2005-01-17 12:00:00') Thanks to Xavier Poinsard.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
When locating driver configuration resources, if getClass().getClassLoader() returns null (i.e. the driver was loaded via the bootstrap classloader) then try the system classloader instead.
Load driver configuration in a privileged block, in case there is a lower- privilege caller that does not have read access to the driver's jar.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Name documentation files after there id attributes, not chapter and section numbers, so if people link to them and we reorganize things they have a better change of pointing to the right place.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Fix the PGInterval(String) ctor to correctly set the object's postgresql type. Thanks to Jean-Pierre Pelletier.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Implement Connection.nativeSQL. Thanks to Xavier Poinsard.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Don't map the escaped difference function to levenshtein because that's not the same thing.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Document JDBC escape sequences. Thanks to Xavier Poinsard.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add basic support for JDBC escape for escape char in LIKE string comparisons. Thanks to Xavier Poinsard.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Bugfix and testcase for NPE when using an updateable resultset obtained from a PreparedStatement on a v3 connection. Thanks to Martin Keller.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Reject attempts to update a CONCUR_READ_ONLY resultset. Test fixes and testcase for this.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Correctly handle changes in parameter types when using server prepared statements, by freeing the old statement and repreparin with the new types.
Previously, if a statement was prepared with one set of types and then reused with a different set of types, the driver wouldn't notice and would continue to (try to) use the original prepared statement.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Reenable the refcursor unit test and make it pass. Add a test and update the documentation to reflect that refcursor ResultSets do have working MetaData (at least with the V3 protocol).

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Implement the Describe Statement protocol message. Reallow untyped nulls and get the backend to resolve the type for us (if necessary). Also use this message and a new non-executing query execution to implement PreparedStatement.getMetaData() for an unexecuted statement and PreparedStatement.getParameterMetaData().

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix warnings on javadoc because the comments were attached to fields instead of functions.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Adjust DatabaseMetaData to acknowledge that 8.0 supports savepoints.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Change error message to reflect the driverconfig.properties file name.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Minor code rearrangement to avoid warnings from jikes. Fix several switch-fallthrough bugs detected by jikes.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Updated Turkish translation. Thanks to Nicolai Tufar.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Updated Chinese translation. Thanks to Zhenbang Wei.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Updated Russian translation. Thanks to Serguei Mokhov.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Updated Brazilian Portuguese translation. Thanks to Euler Taveira de Oliveira.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Initial French translation. Thanks to Xavier Poinsard.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Updated French translation. Thanks to Guillame Cottenceau.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Initial German translation. Thanks to Andre Bialojahn.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
In a java MessageFormat you need to double single quotes to get them to work correctly.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Throw exceptions if cancelRowUpdates() or updateRow() are called when on the insert row, per javadoc.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Add a URL parameter (allowEncodingChanges) which allows a client to change the client_encoding variable. This is necessary because server side COPY commands expect the file to be encoded in the client_encoding.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Implement holdable ResultSet support by simply avoiding the use of cursors and fetching all data at once.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Implementation of standard escaped functions ( {fn func()} ) by rewriting to existing PostgreSQL functions. Thanks to Xavier Poinsard.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Check to see if a ResultSet is closed before performing operations on it. This avoids potential NullPointerExceptions and other problems.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Rewrite date/time/timestamp parsing code. Instead of trying to jam it into a format we can use DateFormat.parse on, just read the fields individually.
This fixes problems with BC dates and dates past 9999.
It now also rejects +/- infinity instead of mapping these to arbitrary java values. There is no equivalent.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Since getURL is not implemented, throw an exception, don't just return null.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Reduce number of messages to translate by parameterizing common error messages. Thanks to Xavier Poinsard.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When closing a Statement or ResultSet be sure to close the underlying Query/ResultCursor to release backend resources.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Do not use named statements when batch executing a whole bunch of individual sql statements. We'll never reuse them and they just take up backend resources.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When loading driverconfig.properties files from the classpath, ensure that settings are read in reverse classpath order. This means that settings from files earlier in the classpath override settings from files found at the end of the classpath.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Allow the regression tests to pass when running against an 8.0 server with default_with_oids turned off. Some tests depend on a table having oids.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Implement CallableStatement.getArray.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When retrieving Int8 or Int16 protocol message formats, we need to correctly truncate the Int32 storage used to sign these narrower types. This notably appeared in RowDescription message for variable length datatypes. The Field.length should have been -1, but was 65535.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Rename PGConnectionPool to PGConnectionPoolDataSource to try and better identify it as not actually being a connection pool. Update the documentation to point to the new common org.postgresql.ds classes instead of separate jdbc2/jdbc3 implementations.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Update copyright year to 2005.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When calling toString on a Statement, don't go into a infinite loop.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When determining if the user has changed the client_encoding to something other than unicode, the comparison must be done case insensitively.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Add PSQLState codes to all PSQLExceptions thrown by the driver. Remove the PSQLException ctor that does not take a PSQLState.
Intercept exceptions in PooledConnectionImpl's handlers. When a fatal exception is seen (determined by looking at the exception's SQL state), notify any connection event listeners.
Fix rethrowing of exceptions at the Connection level in PooledConnectionImpl.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by oliver :
Change default autocommit of our CPDS implementation to on, to be consistent with normal connections.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Bail out with a helpful error message if we cannot build or run the test suite because of missing dependencies, junit or ant's junit task.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add a chapter on SSL configuration to the documentation.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Updated Russian translation. Thanks to Serguei Mokhov.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Correctly cast the return value of a CallableStatement when getShort is called. getByte presents a can't happen situation as no function can return a TINYINT because pg doesn't have an equivalent type. Make this throw an exception if we get to this point. Thanks to Christian Niles.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
New Spanish translation. Thanks to Diego A. Gil..

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Make PreparedStatement.setNull(i, Types.BOOLEAN) strongly typed. Previously only Types.BIT was used the boolean oid mapping and Types.BOOLEAN used the unknown oid. Thanks to Alexey Yudichev.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When using large objects for binary data (compatibleVersion < 7.2) support setNull(i, Types.VARBINARY) to set the oid of the large object to NULL. Thanks to Alexey Yudichev.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Update READMEs to reflect the current situation. Thanks to Vadim Nasardinov.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When calling setNull or setObject with Types.CHAR, use the oid of the bpchar pg type, not varchar. Correct array creation that was using char, not bpchar. Type all textual data as varchar instead of text because it allows the correct comparison to be made with char data on text with trailing spaces: SELECT ' '::char = ' '::varchar;

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Brazilian translation update. Thanks to Euler Taveira de Oliveira.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Make fastpath/largeobject code aware of transaction state, so that in autocommit off mode it will start a new transaction if necessary. Thanks to Alexey Yudichev.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Bit shifting code had a typo that incorrectly reconstructed an int from a byte[]. This fixes a problem with large objects on systems whose oid counter is >= 0x01000000. Thanks to Alexey Yudichev.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Make registerOutParameter work with Types.BOOLEAN. Thanks to Christian Niles.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Disallow these cases as we have insufficient type information: setNull(i, Types.OTHER), setObject(i, null), setObject(i, null, Types.OTHER). Fix updateable result sets so they pass type information on when setting a column to NULL.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Don't allow a negative fetch size to be set on a ResultSet.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Make sure that ds/* really is included in the set of files to compile (fixes some dependency problems with partial builds).

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Make escape syntax processing {oj (and friends) } case insensitive.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Fixes for handling double-quotes and backslashes in single-quoted literals when parsing queries for parameter placeholders.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Updatable ResultSets need to check for an empty ResultSet because isBeforeFirst and isAfterLast both return false for an empty result so the checking to make sure the user is on a valid row wasn't working. Also don't allow an insert without specifying at least one column value because INSERT INTO tab() values() is a syntax error.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When splitting up a multistatement query to be executed individually do not consider a whitespace only query to be significant. The original code correctly considered "SELECT 1;" to be one query, but thought "SELECT 1; " was two queries.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When a connection attempt is made that does not provide a username, then let this go through to the server as the empty string producing a "no user name specified" error instead of a NullPointerException.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When executing a batch statement that has two statements in it, we get confused and bail out with a "Too many update results" message. This message construction was producing an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException because it wasn't checking bounds properly. Thanks to Alan Stange.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Standardize copyright notices and use of the PostgreSQL cvs keyword. Update copyright years to 2004.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Upgrade website to use forrest 0.6.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by oliver :
Allow configuration of the driver by a properties file. All copies of org.postgresql.driverconfig.properties found in the classpath will be read and used to setup defaults for the driver. The most prominent use of this is to allow third parties to provide mappings for custom datatypes.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Set the default prepareThreshold to five per previous discussion.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Indent source code with: astyle -j -p --convert-tabs

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Some general code cleanups. Remove unnecessary imports and a couple unused variables. In the test suite ensure that assertEquals() uses the correct order for expected and actual arguments. Also remove pointless try/catch blocks.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Don't use cursor/portal based fetch methods with autocommit on. The underlying portal will disappear from underneath the driver.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Implement ResultSet.isAutoIncrement by retrieving the column's default value and seeing if there is a "nextval" call in it. Thanks to Jaroslaw J. Pysnzy.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Return serial datatypes in DatabaseMetaData getTypeInfo and getColumns. Thanks to Jaroslaw J. Pysnzy.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
ResultSet.getRow on a cursor/portal backed query was not counting previously discarded data and only returned the row number within the current chunk of data.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Fix setArray when using the v3 protocol. We can't bind arrays as text, we need the correct type. This gets the array type from the Array.getBaseType method. This is a fragile means that depends on a specific Array implementation, but we already depend on a very specific implementation (toString() returning a correctly formatted pg array) that we can live with this.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Update the translation system to use gettext instead of property files.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
For updateable ResultSets make insertRow and deleteRow quote column names like updateRow already does. This makes these methods work on mixed case identifiers. Thanks to Ulrich Meis.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
PreparedStatement.setCharacterStream somehow escaped getting fixed for the old problem of assuming a stream can be read completely in one read() call.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Speed up ResultSet.findColumn by caching the column name to index mapping. Thanks to Phill Tornroth and Peter Mount.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Contstruct the backing hash for updateable resultsets on demand because the vast majority of resultsets aren't updateable. Also change it from a Hashtable to a HashMap because two threads shouldn't be updating the same resultset at the same time.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix typos in error messages and update the pt_BR translation. Thanks to Euler Taveira de Oliveira.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
In 8.0 arrays with non-standard bounds (beginning index != 1) the dimensions are returned in the data like so "[0:3]={0,1,2,3,4}". Add some code to ignore these bounds and match previous server version behavior.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Restructure DataSource code to provide a generic interface in org.postgresql.ds.*. No longer is the jdbc version we compiled for relevent. This allows the driver and regression suite to be compiled with the 1.5 jdk.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Allow users to customize the SSL connection by providing their own SSLSocketFactory implementation. Thanks to Ulrich Meis.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When streaming data from setBinaryStream to the backend, do not allow Exceptions or bad length parameters to cause the connection state to get confused destroying the connection.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Initial translation to Turkish. Thanks to Devrim GUNDUZ.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
ResultSet.moveToCurrentRow was checking the cached updateability flag assuming it had been set instead of correctly calling the isUpdateable() method which sets the flag if needed. This usually worked because moveToCurrentRow is only useful after a moveToInsertRow call which would set the flag, but this is not required. Thanks to David Bucciarelli.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix NullPointerException when doing a multiple query execution in one statement using the V3 protocol. For example Statement.execute("SELECT 1; SELECT 2"); would not have any parameters set and try to iterate over a null array.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Implement support for the Savepoint interface.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add a new file to hold the build number to avoid filling the Driver.java.in commit log with just build number changes. Also add a utility program to print out the driver version and where it was loaded from.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
My version of junit (3.7) doesn't have assertFalse. ArrayTest uses it in a couple of places. This patch changes assertFalse(condition) to assertTrue(!condition).

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Ensure the encoding test drops its table at the end of the run to make sure other tests do not see it and get confused.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Don't make the driver begin a transaction for certain calls. Notably we don't want Connection.getTransactionIsolation() to start a transaction because this is often a check put in before trying to change it and you can't change it in mid-transaction.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Don't report the hashcode of our error message key into the properties file as the vendor error code. This number is completely random and undocumented and ties us into using the current error message keys and implementation to maintain the same codes. Further error messages from the server will not provide this value, so it's best to leave it alone entirely and tell people to use getSQLState().

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
The maxRows variable was preventing using a portal based fetch when it was actually desired. maxRows == 0 is a special case meaning return all rows and needs to be handled differently.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
I recently made a change to report a numeric type that had no size information as numeric(1000,1000) thinking this meant 1000 digits to the right and left of the decimal point. This not the case. I had considered 1000,1000 because 1000 is the limit for both of these arguments and that made some sense although still arbitrary. Moving to something like (1000,500) seems verging on completely random, so I've backpedalled and made it return (-1,-1) because we don't have this information and don't have the ability to return NULL.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Now that ResultSetMetaData returns different results for getColumnName and getColumnLabel, use the underlying table's column name (getColumnName) when working on an updatable ResultSet.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Modify version checking code and descriptions to match the decision that 8.0 will be the next release, not 7.5.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Revert ResultSetMetaData methods getColumnName, getTableName and getSchemaName to previous implementation that returned the column's alias if available and "" for the table and schema. Move the new functionality to access the underlying sources of the query to a new PGResultSetMetaData interface which offers getBaseXXXName. Thanks to Mike Martin.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by davec :
Add ODBC style escape sequences for function {fn ...} and outer join {oj ...}.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
DatabaseMetaData.getSearchString escape was a \ short of working because both Java's String constructor and pg's input parser strip off backslashes.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Change the escape syntax test for functions to actually call a function.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Some ResultSetMetaData fixes. Remove completely duplicated code in the jdbc1/jdbc2 implementations. Recognize "time with timezone" as a java.sql.Types.TIME. Report time/timestamp fractional seconds in getScale(). For unspecified numeric precision/scale use 1000,1000 which is the maximum pg will allow you to specify. Correct getColumnDisplaySize to aware of fractional seconds and timezones for time/timestamp types. Thanks to Dario V. Fassi.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by oliver :
Make the driver generate errors on unknown transaction states in a ReadyForQuery message, rather than silently ignoring them (and probably getting confused).

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by davec :
Added getXXX optional method functionality, allows user to use getXXX to get a byte, short, int, long, double, char via the preferred method as well as the non-preferred. For instance getByte can get a short, int, long, double, or varchar.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When retrieving an array of numerics it attempted to set the scale on the retrieved data to zero, which doesn't work for non-integer values. Also allow a ResultSet created from an Array to be scrolled and add some test cases to make sure things work. Thanks to Oliver Dauben.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Now that JDBC1 is no longer supported merge the implemention of JDBC1 methods into the JDBC2 classes.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Add the ability to compile with the 1.5 Beta 2 JDK. Sun has altered the JDBC API without altering the version number, so I've created a new jdbc3g subdirectory for a "JDBC3 w/ Generics" implementation. This doesn't support compiling the DataSource implementations as they don't have the same multi-version architecture that the core driver does.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Fix decodeUTF8 that was broken in build 303.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Don't throw an Exception in locatorsUpdateCopy() even though the ability to update LOBs is unimplemented. The 1.5 JDK's CachedRowSet implementation calls this method regardless of whether large objects are used or not. Thanks to Kevin MacClay.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix updatable ResultSets stream methods (ascii, character, binary). The existing code didn't correctly allocate data arrays, and it failed to loop when a stream didn't provide the full amount of data requested of it. Thanks to Jan de Visser.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix some problems with result sets positioned before the start or after the end of results. You could still call a number of methods on them like getXXX, updateXXX, and updateRow().

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Review recent getUDT implementation. Filter out base and pseudo types if no type array is specified. Correctly handle a zero length type array.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix apparently harmless typo in build.xml. {$srcdir} -> ${srcdir} Thanks to Markus Schaber.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by oliver :
Modularize query execution and add complete V3 protocol support.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Fix NullPointerException on Statement.clearBatch() when addBatch() hasn't been called.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by blind :
Added a cvsignore for PSQLException.java since this file is now generated.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Enforce the requirement that you must have a scrollable resultset to call some methods (last(), absolute(), etc). Without this patch, these methods complete "normally" but can return incorrect data if the resultset is backed by a cursor. It also adds tests for this behaviour, and fixes a number of tests and one case in the driver itself that try to use these methods with the wrong resultset type.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix TimeTests for jdk1.2 and 1.3. Pre 1.4 JVMs consider the nanoseconds field of a java.sql.Timestamp completely separate and do not return the milliseconds in getTime(). Add a new JVM version test in TestUtil to allow both cases.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Fix the various ResultSet position querying methods (isFirst, isLast, isBeforeFirst, isAfterLast) to work on TYPE_FORWARD_ONLY ResultSets that are backed by a cursor.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When calling stmt.executeUpdate the statement only returns a row count with INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE/MOVE, other statments should return zero as the affected row count. The existing driver behavior was to return whatever the last count was instead of resetting to zero.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Track transaction status and only issue a BEGIN command on the first statement executed, not immediately after the previous commit or rollback. This should help the long standing, but recently very unpopular "idle in transaction" behavior.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Fix failures in TimeTest for timezones ahead of GMT. This produces a Time value before the epoch which came up with negative values.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Allow the regression tests to run successfully against a 7.2 server. 7.2 apparently doesn't like casting a timestamp with time zone to time without time zone, so we've got to cast through an intermediate timestamp without time zone.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Allow updateable ResultSets to support types that aren't directly mappable to Java types, for example cidr. Thanks to Moray Taylor.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
While ResultSets created by ResultSet rs = connection.createStatement().executeQuery(sql); default to TYPE_FORWARD_ONLY per spec, ResultSets created as the result of a DatabaseMetaData call should be more flexible and allow scrollable calls to be made. Thanks to Moray Taylor.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Update the build.xml file to support building with the new 1.5 jdk and ant 1.6. Rename the 1.4 specific replacement variable in PSQLException to describe it's true meaning (the existence of Throwable.initCause()).

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Allow public access to radius field to match other geometric types behavior. Thanks to Declan Lynch.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Remove the old style javadoc entries for extensions that were copy and pasted into the documentation. Add a javadoc build target to produce documentation for the external API. At the moment this leaves the extensions chapter pretty bare, but it would be better to fill that in with helpful examples than simply regurgitating the API in an inconvenient format.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by oliver :
Allow enabling server side prepared statements globally without writing pg specific code by setting the prepared statement threshold in the connection url or datasource. Instead of a simple on/off flag, the prepared statement mechanism is an execution count threshold, so ideally it will turn itself on for frequently used queries while not getting in the way of one time use executions.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add documentation for using listen/notify with JDBC.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by davec :
Implement DatabaseMetaData.getUDT

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Update the expected foreign key name results to match the new 7.5 backend behavior. Generated foreign key names are now usefully named based on the table and columns instead of things like $1.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
When deleteRow() is called on an updateable ResultSet the ResultSet should be positioned on the previous row. Thanks to Bob Messenger and Chris Pesarchick.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by jurka :
Now that we are out of the main tree, we can't rely on the makefile system to tell us about versions and ports and other options so we are at least temporarily back to using a hardcoded build.properties file.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Newer versions of the 1.4.2 jdk give warnings about having return in a finally clause.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Use the new information available in the V3 protocol to implement ResultSetMetaData methods describing the underlying tables: getSchemaName, getTableName, getColumnName, getColumnLabel, and isNullable. Thanks to Jan-Andre le Roux.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by oliver :
Modify various testcases and test support code so they do not catch-and-rethrow SQLExceptions as assertion failures. This means you actually see the original exception (and under 1.4, any nested exception) without any extra work; it also makes the code a bit easier to read.

item.title: MyProject update
item.description:
update by oliver :
Enable test cases related to server side prepare and transforming to a cursor based fetch which previously were failing.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by oliver :
Be spec compliant in creating ResultSets that are of TYPE_FORWARD_ONLY by default. This allows us to be more aggressive in using scrollable ResultSets because they are usable by default. Also correctly track the values for result set type, concurrency, and fetch direction in both the ResultSet and Statement.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Fix the setXXXStream methods. If passed a null InputStream, convert this to a setNull call. The code originally would try to read the whole stream in one call to read(), but this doesn't work. The InputStream API makes it clear you must be prepared to loop and continue reading if you didn't get the whole request on the first try. Thanks to Martin Holz.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
ResultSet.next() and previous() incremented or decremented the internal current_row variable regardless of wether they succeeded or not. This generated some ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsExceptions when the errorneous adjustment current_row led to out of range values.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by davec :
Added xml docbook documentation. Thanks to Peter Eisentraut.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
ConnectionPool and SimpleDataSource are marked Serializable, but their superclass (which contains a number of state variables) is not. To correctly serialize these objects we need to manually implement writeObject and readObject. Thanks to R. Lemos.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Add documentation validation target which doesn't require additional xml libraries beyond those that come with ant. Also add the ability to customize a local build via a build.local.properties file. In this file you can set the necessary parameters for the docbook dtds and stylesheets to match your installation.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
V3 NotificationResonse messages were trying to be received as V2 messages. Also the PID was being read in the wrong byte order. Additionally add a stub for the currently unimplemented notify parameter. Finally add a test case for listen/notify.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by davec :
Added documentation for Tomcat setup.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by davec :
Added rudimentary PGInterval class to deal with retrieving intervals via getObject.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by davec :
Added StatementTest to test for statement re-use, fixed ResultSetTest to pass this test.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by davec :
Added a check to make sure statements weren't being re-used after being closed.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Improve V3 protocol startup to reduce roundtrips to the server. Thanks to Chris Smith.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by oliver :
Support JDK 1.4-style exception chaining in PSQLException. Various cleanups to PSQLException constructors, don't override where not necessary.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by davec :
Added functionality to deal with the timetz datatype, and handle msec better.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by davec :
Modified ResultSet.getTime routines to use a calendar if available.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Update documentation to reflect the current build process. Note the restrictions on using cursor based ResultSets.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
If the user has requested a SSL connection and the driver has not been compiled with SSL support throw an Exception instead of silently falling back to a non SSL connection.

item.title: MyProject add
item.description:
add by jurka :
Document the additional connection parameters that specify pg specific behavior: ssl, compatible, loglevel, and charSet.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by jurka :
Closing a Connection or Statement object twice should be a no-op instead of throwing an Exception. Thanks to Victor Sergienko.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by davec :
Added additional tests for time, timestamps, and fixed code to pass.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by davec :
Hungarian translation update. Thanks to Lazlo Hornyak.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by blind :
Fixed bug where the V3 protocol support was not properly handling binary cursors. Also fixed a compile problem with the test suite under jdk1.2 and 1.3. Also fixed a problem with OID74Test which wasn't commiting a table drop so it was leaving a table in the database after the test run.

item.title: MyProject fix
item.description:
fix by davec :
Fix Statement.toString to handle binary integer and Float types
